citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS), Alaska Fisheries Science Center (AFSC)
citeinfo.title: AFSC Otolith Collection Database

abstract.p: This database is an inventory of fish ageing samples (otoliths) from the Bering Sea, Aleutian Islands, and Gulf of Alaska collected and aged by the Alaska Fisheries Science Center. The database includes otoliths from Resource Assessment and Conservation Engineering (RACE) surveys and the North Pacific Groundfish Observer Program domestic and foreign collections. Survey collection inventories contain records from 1971 to present, although the exact number of samples collected is only available from 1986 to present. Foreign observer records are available from 1982 to 1990 and domestic observer records are from 1986 to present.

The database is searchable by common name and returns numbers aged and collected by area. Vessel and cruise information is available for survey collections, and collection numbers for the Observer program are available by NMFS area.

The collections are searable online at http://access.afsc.noaa.gov/al/searchform.cfm . In addition, a summary of RACE and Observer collections is available online at http://access.afsc.noaa.gov/al/CollectionTotals.cfm
The information in this database are approximations subject to daily updates.
Questions regarding these collections should be directed to Jon Short at jon.short@noaa.gov.

descript.purpose: To archive and provide Otolith data collected by the AFSC programs.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
